In a message dated 7/31/03 6:42:38 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
jefhdvm@... writes:

> Janet, aka plant killer (yes, the flowers in my windowboxes are currently
> crisped :( )
>

Oh Janey, this reminded me of the bamboo I killed last year. Apparently it
has all these meanings and is supposed to survive everything and bring you luck
and prosperity...needless to say it was the unlucky one.

Rhonda

messages.subject: Re: Gardening (and black thumbs :)
messages.msgSnippet: I, too, kill every plant I touch - except Pothos Ivy.  They can be shriveled up and dead looking, leaves all wilted, and they somehow revive when I finally get
messages.messageBody:
I, too, kill every plant I touch - except Pothos Ivy. They can be shriveled
up and dead looking, leaves all wilted, and they somehow revive when I
finally get around to watering them.

I've never overwatered them, though (can't remember to, plus they are up
high so I need to get out the step stool, making it more involved than just
dumping a half-empty glass of water over them on the way to the kitchen).

Janet, aka plant killer (yes, the flowers in my windowboxes are currently
crisped :( )
